image.altText: A young woman with glasses puts her arms on top of cabinet

props.synopsis: From late next month, the University of Adelaide and the University of South Australia will begin to cease operations and transform to become Adelaide University. But as the clock ticks, some students and staff are feeling the pressure.

title.children: Students, teaching staff face challenges amid Adelaide University merger

image.altText: A Brisbane AFLW player looks to shake hands with a teammate after kicking a goal as others smile.

props.synopsis: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

title.children: Lions roar in Melbourne on way to AFLW prelim, Crows end Saints' season

image.altText: Kangaroo road sign

props.synopsis: Drivers on regional roads are being warned of an increase in kangaroo activity on South Australian roads, with large mobs of roos seen lining roads at dawn and dusk, creating growing safety concerns for road users.

title.children: 'Dodging them everywhere': Warning to SA drivers over kangaroo risk increase

image.altText: An airplane dropping a sheet of water, darkening the ground, in a eucalypt forest

props.synopsis: Ahead of bushfire season, the SA Country Fire Service's air operations teams clear out the cobwebs and take to the skies to simulate bushfires in the Flinders Ranges.

title.children: Country Fire Service prepares for summer by taking to the air

image.altText: A hospital side alley that looks gloomy

props.synopsis: SA's Health Minister has apologised to a patient who was ramped outside hospital for several hours as the government releases its ambulance ramping data for October, which is at a six-month low.

title.children: Apology issued to woman stuck in ambulance outside hospital

image.altText: A man with brown hair speaks into a microphone and adjusts his red Make American Great Again cap

props.synopsis: A school investigation has been launched after an Adelaide teacher allegedly dressed up as slain US conservative activist Charlie Kirk for Halloween, with the school's principal slamming the decision to wear such a costume as "completely unacceptable".

title.children: School sorry for 'unacceptable' Charlie Kirk costume at Halloween event

image.altText: A woman with red hair shows the solar power app on her phone with a house with solar panels behind her.

props.synopsis: There has been a flurry of installations in home batteries and rooftop solar in Mount Gambier following the launch of a community bulk-buy renewables program.

title.children: SA city's bulk-buy renewables program drives surge in battery and solar uptake

image.altText: Paul Logos wears glasses and a navy and white striped polo shirt. Behind him is sand coloured brick and red flowers.

props.synopsis: Paul Logos may never know for sure if his wife's recent death could have been preventable by helipad access. Six helipads throughout regional South Australia remain closed due to issues in certifying their safety.

title.children: Paul may never know if his wife's death was preventable by helipad access

image.altText: Close up photo of a woman on a missing poster

props.synopsis: Police are not ruling out returning to a property near Mount Gambier where they searched yesterday for the remains of Margaret Bernie, who was last seen in the South Australian city in 1988.

title.children: Search for remains in suspected SA cold case murder unsuccessful

image.altText: Warning sign about asbestos

props.synopsis: An electrician diagnosed with a rare asbestos-related cancer has been awarded a $2.26 million payout for exposure to toxic dust and fibres while working for various employers, including at the old Royal Adelaide Hospital.

title.children: Former RAH electrician awarded $2.26m asbestos cancer payout

image.altText: A woman in a business suit looks serious while seated

props.synopsis: South Australia's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption (ICAC) Emma Townsend has taken over an anti-corruption commission described by her predecessor as the "weakest integrity agency in Australia". Does she agree?

title.children: SA's ICAC 'busier than ever' despite watered down powers

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: New research awaiting peer review has provided a few revelations about the make-up of South Australia's algal bloom, with a new predominant species — Karenia cristata — identified by scientists. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: What is the new species detected in SA's algal bloom?

image.altText: A bald man in a teal, black and white tie and black jacket speaks to the media at a press conference

props.synopsis: Warren Tredrea's premiership teammate Josh Carr says he will always remain a Port Adelaide legend despite being sacked from the club's board last week.

title.children: Port coach denies Tredrea kicked out of club despite board sacking

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: South Australia's childcare regulator has cancelled the registration of just one provider in recent years, while nearly 10,000 reported incidents have resulted in no further action, FOI documents obtained by the ABC have revealed.

title.children: Nearly 10,000 SA childcare incidents reported resulted in 'no action'

image.altText: A serious-looking man in a suit and glasses.

props.synopsis: Ahead of meetings to agree on a Liberal climate policy, the leading moderate says his party must retain a focus on achieving net zero better than Labor.

title.children: Bragg vows to quit frontbench if Liberals ditch net zero

image.altText: A man in a suit waving to crowds.

props.synopsis: Zohran Mamdani's victory in Tuesday's New York City mayoral election looked unlikely at one point. Polling shows it was women who helped power him into office.

title.children: Critics mocked Zohran Mamdani. Women helped him have the last laugh

image.altText: Men in tracksuits raise their arms together in triumph, one holding maracas.

props.synopsis: Playing to a combined audience of about 320,000 people, Liam and Noel Gallagher's return to Australia for this much-hyped tour has been nothing short of a triumph.

title.children: Oasis leaves Australia triumphant after gigantic sold-out tour

image.altText: Mar Riek stands side on to the camera

props.synopsis: When Mar Riek was 13, he dreamed of being a professional basketballer. His family couldn't afford the fees, so he joined a gang and started selling drugs.

title.children: Beefs, drugs and money: Why Melbourne's youth are turning to crime

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair in a white jumper lies under a pink blanket with her hands resting on her stomach.

props.synopsis: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

title.children: Women's pain inquiry finds male-centred health system causing suffering

image.altText: A woman in a strapless ballgown closes her eyes and lifts her head as confetti falls from the ceiling.

props.synopsis: After reading Die My Love in book club, Martin Scorsese knew it had to be made into a film. Now it's rewriting cinema portrayal of womanhood and postpartum depression.

title.children: Jennifer Lawrence was pregnant when she made this film about postpartum depression

image.altText: Smoke from a wildfire billows above green hills.

props.synopsis: Fire and Emergency New Zealand says an out-of-control wildfire in Tongariro National Park has swelled in size to about 1,000 hectares, leading to the evacuation of dozens of hikers.

title.children: 'Hellscape' fire in Tongariro National Park, New Zealand

image.altText: Gough Whitlam speaks into microphone on steps of Parliament House after the dismissal

props.synopsis: Before Gough Whitlam's dismissal and famous speech on the steps of Parliament House, there was silence — and strategy — in the Senate. This is the inside story of how a budget stand-off changed Australian democracy forever.

title.children: The inside story of Gough Whitlam’s dramatic 1975 dismissal

image.altText: A women stands among shrub and looks through a camera on a tripod.

props.synopsis: Parisian-born UN photographer Martine Perret turns her lens to capture the resilience and strength of women in rural Australia.

title.children: UN photographer turns lens on women of rural Australia

image.altText: close up of mum's hand on child's head

props.synopsis: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

title.children: 'You're not my mother': What it's like being a stepmum

image.altText: Annabel Crabb

props.synopsis: Behind the quirks of Australia's incredible democratic system are a series of complex human backstories.

title.children: The story behind Australia's incredible democratic system

image.altText: Alipriya Biswas smiling outside

props.synopsis: International students are grappling with Australia's high cost of living, and experts warn there are no quick fixes to their financial stress.

title.children: $200 a week and tinned fish: Cost of living hits international students

image.altText: A loaded container ship sails off from a container terminal across calm blue waters.

props.synopsis: IMF economists say inflation-targeting central banks did not achieve better outcomes than others following the 2022 surge.

title.children: IMF economists say inflation targeting hasn't performed brilliantly in recent years

image.altText: A copy of Teen Vogue.

props.synopsis: One of publisher Condé Nast's most acclaimed stories this year came from Teen Vogue. Now, it is shuttering the youth publication — and laying off the staff involved.

title.children: Teen Vogue's closure shuts down 'some really nuanced political reporting'

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: I applaud your courage for having a go. That's about it, though.

title.children: Will you get lucky and ace this week's quiz? I wouldn't bet on it

image.altText: A large smoke plume illuminated in bright orange rising above trees and power poles at dusk, while cars have bright lights on.

props.synopsis: The US firms say they are grounding their fleets of McDonnell Douglas MD-11 planes "out of an abundance of caution" after 14 people were killed earlier this week.

title.children: UPS and FedEx ground MD-11 cargo planes after deadly Kentucky crash

image.altText: A close up of a little boy smiling

props.synopsis: When Skye Scott took her son to a paediatrician, she never imagined he would be diagnosed with the life-changing Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

title.children: The rare genetic disorder shortening the life span of boys

image.altText: Four transparent trophies shaped like intertwined heads of cartoon emu and kangaroo with crossed-out eyes, sit outdoors on table

props.synopsis: The centrepiece of triple j's Ausmusic Month celebrations, the J Awards is celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2025. Here's how it all began.

title.children: The history of the J Awards aligns with Australia's best music

image.altText: A man leads a Samoan rugby league team in a war dance

props.synopsis: The passion of the Pacific shines through in Samoa's rugby league team, and the pride the people have is evident on the island.

title.children: Pancakes, pride and passion as Samoa creates rugby league magic

image.altText: Damage to the outside of a brown apartment building after an air strike.

props.synopsis: A Russian drone slams into an apartment building in eastern Ukraine, killing three people, while another is killed at an energy site, Ukrainian authorities report.

title.children: Russian drone and missile barrage in eastern Ukraine kills four

image.altText: Several men stand on a golf course looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: Golf has a reputation for being expensive and exclusive — but on this island in Bass Strait, things are a bit more relaxed.

title.children: At Marra Wunna golf course, views are spectacular and shoes are optional
